qas.question: In what year did Rothko donate Passion of Christ murals?
To whom did Rothko donate Passion of Christ murals?
What organic reds did Rothko use in the Passion of Christ murals?
In what year had the Passion of Christ murals by Rothko end up ruined?
What was the result of the change in color in the Rothko Passion of the Christ murals?

answers.text: ruined and had to be taken down

qas.question: What year were synthetic pigments first used?
Who first used synthetic pigments in 1962?

plausible_answers.text: paintings were ruined and had to be taken down.

context: <b6_0>Rothko<b6_0/> also began using the new synthetic pigments, but not always with happy results. In <a0_0><b5_0>1962<b5_0/><a0_0/> he donated to <a1_0><b7_0>Harvard University<b7_0/><a1_0/> a series of large murals of the Passion of Christ whose predominant colors were dark pink and deep crimson. He mixed mostly traditional colors to make the pink and crimson; synthetic ultramarine, cerulean blue, and titanium white, but he also used two new organic reds, <a2_0>Naphtol and Lithol<a2_0/>. The Naphtol did well, but the Lithol slowly changed color when exposed to light. Within five years the deep pinks and reds had begun to turn light blue, and by <a3_0>1979<a3_0/> the <b8_0>paintings were <a4_0>ruined and had to be taken down<a4_0/>.
